page.title: 03Landscapes around Lullington
page.content: Some farms have been made larger by amalgamation with others bordering onto the area. This process has resulted in the removal of hedges and trees to create larger fields. The equipment used by the modern farmers also demand vast areas for turning and so the traditional smaller fields are unsuitable. A survey carried out to investigate field size proved that the amalgamated farms had enlarged their fields to a greater extent. Sizes ranged from 16 to 38 acres per field. On the smaller farms the average field size was about 10 acres. In such cases farmers were reluctant to remove hedges because of its effect on the wildlife and general appearance of the area.
